result.execSummary:
The defendant Daniel A Lewellyn was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case. One or more other charges in this case were dismissed. The dismissed charges were not proven and have no legal effect. Daniel A Lewellyn is presumed innocent of the dismissed charges.

  • Daniel A Lewellyn was found guilty of Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Daniel A Lewellyn was found guilty of Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).
  • Daniel A Lewellyn was found guilty of Intent. Contribute/Delinquency Child, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes: Undergo any counseling/treatment per agent.  No contact w/T.B.  No ctonact with any children under the age of 18 without agent's prior consent.  ALL COURT ORDERED OBLIGATIONS TO BE PAID THROUGH CLERK OF COURTS WITHIN 60 DAYS OR SET UP PAYMENT ARRANGEMENTS.

If extended supervision revoked or discharges with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant in favor of restitution victims and/or governmental entities for the balance due.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.

letter brief from atty. Sheets
Cover Letter from Atty. Hoffman
Motion hearing (partial transcript/testimony of DL) 7/19/16

Attorney Eric Sheets appeared by phone means for Defendant Daniel A Lewellyn. Prosecuting Atty Linda Ann Hoffman appeared by phone for State of Wisconsin.  Parties have discussed the case.  State states the other acts - there should not be a hearing on Texas incident. DE has then an opportunity to cross examine of victim and that may stress.  Submit to the court offer of proof or affidavits of witness' to let court know testimony.  State also believes expense would be big.  Court examines State about implausablility.   Atty. Sheets believes need a hearing and explains.  Court expresses concerns on other acts evidence and doesn't want to get in mid trial and have to make a decision.  State concurs with doing alot of what testimony/witness' would do in paper form.  Atty. Sheets disagrees - creditiblity case and affidavits would not express that.  DE should have a chance to cross examine.  State believes DE doesn't have the right.  Atty. Sheets makes statement.  Court states DE should reply to State's motions & briefs in writing.  Parties would like to try to keep trial on in mid Oct. but not sure it will.  Atty. Sheets will have written response by 9/19/16.  State respond by 9/26/16.  Written decisions by the Court on all the motions by 9/30/16.
Scheduling conference on August 19, 2016 at 11:30 am.

Defendant Daniel A Lewellyn in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Rick C Spoentgen and Linda A. Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Continued DE motion in limine.  Detective Stacy McClure, S&T.  Atty. Sheets cross exam witness.  State objects - speculation.  Atty. Sheets states foundation.  Court sustains and to lay foundation.  Atty. Hoffman objects - beyond motion being heard today.  Atty. Sheets withdraws question and may ask at a later time depending on testimony.  State redirect.  State calls D Hinze n/k/a Halverson, S&T.  Atty. Sheets cross exam.  Break and start with DE motion in limine.  Back on record 2:50 - take up motions #14-19.  DE to take up evidence on false allegations of TB #14 motion.  #15 allegations of assault S.M. #16 evidence TB alleged asault of biological father.  #17 allegations TB of assault by MB.  #12 assault by EB. #13 assault by TM. #11 assault by JM. Parties did brief these matters. Atty. Sheets there will be more witnesses than what has tesified in these motions already.  Atty. Sheets states addresses prior motions of #1-#11 for housekeeping matter.  Court states will do those by the end of the day.  Atty. Sheets agrees with sites mentioned and statutes.  Atty. Sheets states on JM allegation.  Evidence is value, creditibility of witness.  Atty. Hoffman makes argument - no link to this.  Atty. Sheets needs discovery on JM police reports. Court denies motion. Motion #13 - TM allegation.  Atty. Sheets states this is admissible and hearsay can be in on this one.  State makes argument sites Ronrude, court would be bound by answers from the victim. Atty. Sheets responds. #14 allegation of SM.  Court states no testimony of recantation. Court denies motion #15.  Court denies motion #16. Court denies motion #17.  Court states before rule #11-13. Did TB make allegations in 2004.  Defense has not seen reports.  Court believes it is significant of 9 years passing b/w 3 allegations and the recent allegation and Court is not comfortable deciding those motions as of right now. Atty. Sheets makes argument.  Court giving Atty. Sheets more time to look into the prior allegations. Court states Sullivan analysis on #14 and the same with #19.  Atty. Sheets is regarding Texas law, not rape shield, not sexual act.  #3 agreed. #4 not excluding TB from courtroom. Atty. Sheets makes argument on creditiblity and fairness/prejudice to defendant.  Court still denies.  Court excludes all witnesses during voir dire but can be in during introduction so prosepective jurors can see them.  #5 take up as trial prep and is in instruction 50.  #6 no objection. #7 no objection.  #8 agreed. #9 no objection but maybe TB.  #10 granted. There is plausiblity. Court needs to review sites that State brought up.  State has no objection on putting together an affidavit. Court needs additional information.  Need more hearings. Atty. Sheets states it comes down to the 3rd prong.  Court encourages parties to talk.  Scheduling conference scheduled for August 19, 2016 at 11:30 am.
Motion hearing (partial transcript) 7/19/16
of ADA Hoffman

Defendant Daniel A Lewellyn in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Rick C Spoentgen and Linda Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Court officer S. McClure appears.  Motions #14-17 of defendants to be discussed today.  9:17 am Atty. Sheets calls D.L., S&T. State redirect.  Court directs of witness.  Atty. Sheets cross exam. 11:43 Atty. Sheets calls D.H., S&T.  Break until 1.  Witness retakes the stand.  State cross exam.  Atty. Sheets redirect.  Atty.'s talk off record about witness staying and testifying on other acts or have to come back at next motion hearing.  Atty. Hoffman states if even an evidentiary hearing is needed on other acts motion.  Atty. Sheets states an evidentiary is needed regarding this.  Court directs of Atty. Sheets.  Atty. Sheets states State needs to narrow this down. Court doesn't see that this is practicial today.  Atty. Sheets requests D.H. appear by phone or video if need be.  Court has no objection to that if get that point. Atty. Sheets calls T.B., S&T.  State cross exam.  Court directs witness.  Atty. Sheets redirect. Atty. Hoffman recross.  Atty. Sheets redirect.  Atty. Hoffman calls J.F-G., S&T. Atty. Sheets cross exam.  Atty. Hoffman redirect. Atty. Hoffman calls detective Stacy McClure, SCSD, S&T.  Atty. Sheets will do cross exam on next motion date and directs to the Court on evidentiary hearing.

Motion hearing on August 17, 2016 at 01:00 pm.

Defendant Daniel A Lewellyn in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Linda Ann Hoffman and Rick S. appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court addresses status.  Attorney Sheets clarifies and agrees with status of motions.  Court to go through motions one by one.  Court and parties address all numbered motions.  No prior convictions of defendant.  State naming McClure as court officer and victim will remain in courtroom throughout trial.  No objection by State to #6.  State opposes #11-#17.  Court request clarification on #19.  Court addresses to State's motion.  Objection and argument to #1-4.  No objection by Attorney Sheets to #5.  Attorney Sheets addresses #6.  State argues, responds to objection of Attorney Sheets to #6.  No objection by Attorney Sheets to #7.  Agreement on #9 & #10.  Court addresses briefing schedule.  Off the record to discuss scheduling.  Collateral and Issue Preclusion Briefs due Monday, April 25.  Response briefs by both due by May 3.  Written decision by court on those issues.  Other Acts on #18 & #19 and any other issues due by Attorney Sheets on May 23.  Attorney Sheet's response/replay due July 5.  State's response/reply filing June 20.  State advises notice of expert.  Attorney Sheets agrees, however may timely object.  Exchange of final witness list July 19.  Attorney Sheet's request electronic communication of briefs vs. regular mail.  State agrees.  Fax to the court.  Motion hearing scheduled for August 17, 2016 at 01:00 pm.  Motion hearing scheduled for July 19, 2016 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Daniel A Lewellyn in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Court officer Stacy McClure appears.  Court prepared to make ruling on briefs filed.  14CF1 was prior case that was dismissed.  Charges in 15CF337 are exactly the same.  Court recv'd exhibit from preliminary in prior case.  State v. Miller  217para. 19; 226wis2nd210 paragraph 19.  Concur with State there is no significant differences in 3rd factor.  5th factor - key factor, fundamental fair factor - and for those reasons Court preclusion applies here, probable cause for bind over is appropriate.

Preliminary hearing at 01-29-2016 10:00 am

Defendant Daniel A Lewellyn in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Linda Ann Hoffman appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State ready to proceed.  14CF1 cited and request judicial notice of Transcript of previous transcript filed and to be marked as an exhibit today.  Marked exh 1.  Court takes judicial notice.  Attorney Sheets questions whether there will be a witness called.  Objects to Exh 1 being entered and used vs. a witness.  New case.  State responds.  Attorney Sheets responds with continued argument..new case.  Court received exh. 1.  Issue preclusion addressed and argued by counsel.  Counsel to submit in writing, briefing on the issue preclusion for purposes of preliminary hearing within 20 days (January 4, 2016).  State allowed 10 days to reply (January 14, 2016).  Attorney Sheets to receive another 10 days to provide response (Janaury 21, 2016).  Set for continued Preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for January 29, 2016 at 10:00 am.

Defendant Daniel A Lewellyn in court with attorney Eric Sheets.  Sue Mueller appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant waives reading of complaint.  State request $10,000 signature bond w/ conditions.  Attorney Sheets agrees w/ signature bond.  Objects to the supervision condition.  Request preliminary hearing.  Time limits are waived. $10,000.00 SIGNATURE bond set.  Special bond conditions as follows:  No contact with TMB, her children and her residence.  No unsupervised contact with females under the age of 18 years.  Booking today.   Pre-trial conference scheduled for October 23, 2015 at 11:45 am.  Return date scheduled for November 6, 2015 at 01:00 pm.
